Characteristics[NumberOfBiologicalReplic: Three biological replicates were prepared for each group
Characteristics[NumberOfSamples]: Eight spleens from Infected individuals and five from Controls were used for histology and mass spectrometry analyses.
Characteristics[ReductionReagent]: dithiothreitol (Sigma Aldrich, St. Louis, MO, USA)
Characteristics[AlkylationReagent]: iodoacetamide (GE Healthcare, Little Chalfont, Buckinghamshire, UK)
Comment[Separation]: nanoUHPLC UltiMate® 3,000 (Dionex, San Jose, USA) system

a reverse phase chromatography was performed using an Acclaim PepMap18 RSLC (75 μm i.d. × 15 cm, 2 μm, 100 Å; Thermo Scientific) column (in tandem with the previously mentioned column), maintained at 40°C with a constant flow rate of 0.3 μL/min.
Comment[Instrument]: Q Exactive mass spectrometer (Thermo Scientific®, Bremen, Germany) operating at full-scan/MS2 mode
Comment[GradientTime]: a conditioning step with 3.8% of B was applied on the first 3min, followed by a ramp from 3.8 to 30% B over 120min and 30–50% B between 120 and 150min, with a final ramp with 99% B to 162min and a reconditioning step with 3.8% B until 180min.
Comment[MS2MassAnalyzer]: product ion spectra were acquired with a resolution of 17,500
Comment[IonizationType]: ion source was set at 3.8 kV with a capillary temperature of 250°C
